history.content:
Yea I think this is manageable. 70 and 61C can be  lot of work though.

===

I had this exact schedule (70 + 16B + 61C) my first semester sophomore year - it's doable, but you will find that once project season rolls around, you'll always have one of {70 homework, 16b homework, 61C homework, 61C project} due; probably one of each per week during the peak of the semester.
Yea I think this is manageable. 70 and 61C can be  lot of work though.

children.subject:
Those three classes look pretty good, but you should probably not add something big on top of that.  

It probably not worth it to try to rush and take these other upper div courses.

I would say it is worth it to take Math 110 in the future. 
 For other useful classes for later on 
Definetly take CS 170
EECS 126, 127 are useful
math 104, 113 potentially
?? OP said hes taking in the summer. It's at the bottom of his post.
Just wondering, where are you taking physics 7b?

history.content:
I have taken 61A and 53, did well in both, and am currently in 61B and EE 16A. As an EECS major, I know I was supposed to take 16A in the fall, but my advisor gave me the impression that there was no rush to begin the 16 series, so now I'm a semester behind, but trying to catch up.

For sure, I'm gonna take 70 + 16B in the fall. My question is, what should I pair with it if I want to take a third tech? I'm really interested in maximizing how many upper divs I take, so I was leaning towards taking 61C as it's the last "gateway" class, but from what I've heard, the combo of 70 + 16B + 61C is a pretty big workload. I've heard that 188, which as a smaller workload, is possible to be taken alongside 70 (even though 70's a prereq), but is not recommended. Every other upper div essentially builds on 70 or 61C so I can't really take those. Any advice on what to take? Would Math 110 be beneficial since I haven't taken 54 to solidify my linear algebra since I'm learning it strictly through the 16 series? Are there any CS/EE/Math/tech courses people can recommend to prepare me for upper divs or just because they're interesting?

P.S. I'm taking Physics 7B over the summer at a CC, if that opens anything up.
history.subject: 70 + 16B + 61C together?
